Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2008 02:00PM barb33594 wrote: Hi All, I will be starting chemo on Tueday 4/8; and I am quite apprehensive.  My nerves are shot.  And I am not sure how to use these message boards.  There are many of you that I would like to IM.  Is that possible or do you have to post and message and wait for a reply?   Some of us have the same dx and our tx days seem to coincide.  Can someone please help me regarding sending and receiving messages; or do I just come back here and read the board?   Thanks to all of my new found friends and I wish you all well and Godspeed.  Barbara
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2008 05:04PM barb33594 wrote: Hi all, Well I just endured my first chemo treatment and all of my anxiety and nervousness was uncalled for.  These nurses know what they are doing and made it okay right from the start.  I went through it okay; but am not looking forward to day 3 and 4 guess when the side effects kick in.  Cinlee trust me you are not alone ...  just look at these boards and check out the chat room. Hang in there..   The best is yet to come (hopefully when it is all over).   (((((((((((hugs to everyon))))))))))))
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2008 02:22PM barb33594 wrote: Thank you Otter for your help.  I have been in the chat rooms and they are overwhelming at times so  I was told to try this avenue.  But it seemed confusing to me.  I will try it for awhile and see what happens.  If you see me doing something wrong, let me know.  When were you dx Otter?  Have you had chemo yet?   Barbara

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2008 03:32PM barb33594 wrote: Hey Otter, Hang in there.  Your post could have been written by me word for word.  Guess our tx sessions are in line with each other and our se are the same; as well as your comments about the wigs. One thing that I have not read about is profusely perspiration.  I have not stopped sweating.  And no one has mentioned that.   I wonder now if it is normal. Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2008 02:20PM barb33594 wrote: Hi Tiff, Thanks for the welcome; no I am sure none of us want to be here; but then none of us wanted to have cancer either.  Thanks for the info.  As I said, I start chemo on the 8th with 4 tx (cytoxan and taxotere).  I just had a port put in this week and that went well; but this upcoming chemo tx has me a bundle of nerves.  Yes, I want to get it over with; but once again it is the fear of the unknown.  Thanks again Tiff and I will see if I can work this board.  Barbara
